title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. A DateTime type report parameter in BIRT report designer accepts an invalid date string in the default value field, such as '55/66/9999'. The report design then shows the following definition in the parameters section: <parameters> <scalarparameter name='dateParam1'> <property name='dataType'>dateTime</property> <property name='allowBlank'>false</property> <property name='format'>Unformatted</property> <property name='controlType'>textbox</property> <expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression> </scalarparameter> </parameters>. There are two problems here: (1) The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale independent, to ensure portability.
OB: When a DateTime type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer and an invalid date string is entered in the default value field, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value is accepted and included in the report design.
EB: When a DateTime type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer and an invalid date string is entered in the default value field, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value should be rejected and a validation error message should be displayed. The report design should not include the invalid value in the parameters section.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report design.
3. Add a DateTime type report parameter.
4. In the default value field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Validate the report design.
Expected: A validation error message should be displayed indicating that the entered date value is invalid.
6. Check the parameters section of the report design.
Expected: The invalid date value should not be included in the parameters section.
